ai-ud7.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud7.8:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākaccāna was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight and mindfulness of the body well-established in himself.
ai-ud7.8:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud7.8:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud7.8:4.2_0: Attending to mindfulness relating to the body, (thinking):
ai-ud7.8:4.3_0: and it might not be mine.
ai-ud7.8:4.4_0: It will not be, and it will not be mine.’
ai-ud7.8:4.5_0: Meditating stage by stage on that,
ai-ud7.8:4.6_0: in time they’d cross over clinging.”
